results.title: The Office: the complete second series [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant, Ash Atalla and BBC
results.brief_description: The Office is a bitingly satirical British television series set in a paper merchant’s office and factory in Slough. David Brent, a delusional manager who believes himself to be witty, universally adored, efficient and effective, runs the branch. Series two sees the office of Slough merging with Swindon. In an attempt to win his new staff over, David utilises his trademark off-colour humour. But his attempt at ingratiation only serves to alienate staff. Brent also has a new boss, Neil, a genuinely appealing, popular and efficient manager who stands for none of Brent’s inadequacy. Ep 1: Swindon staff are welcomed to Slough, most of whom get off to a bumpy start with Brent. Ep 2: Brent’s envy of Neil’s style and charm see him act petulantly and treacherously. Ep 3: Tim forms an attraction to new girl, Rachel; their flirtatious interactions trouble Gareth and Dawn. Trudy celebrates her birthday with a boozy evening. Ep 4: Brent prepares for his highly paid motivational speech. Ep 5: comedy relief day brings out the best and worst in staff. Brent is given a formal warning about his work standards. Ep 6: Dawn is conflicted over her future and her romantic life. Adhering to a mockumentary structure, a camera crew follow the workers around, documenting office life - boredom, bad jokes, uncomfortable moments, embarrassing faux pas and the emptiness of at work interactions that pass the day. Features fine performances and much hilarious to-camera addresses, skillfully capturing the monotony of office work, where relieving ennui is a fulltime job.

results.title: The Office: the complete first series [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ricky Gervais, Stephen Merchant, Ash Atalla and BBC
results.brief_description: First series of the bitingly satirical British television series, “The Office”. Ricky Gervais plays David Brent, the manager of a paper merchant factory and office in Slough. Gervais is an identifiable type in the workplace - a delusional man who believes himself to be witty, universally adored by his staff, efficient, and an effective boss with impeccable people and business skills. Adhering to a mockumentary structure, a camera crew follow the workers around, documenting office life - boredom, bad jokes, uncomfortable moments, embarrassing faux pas and the emptiness of at work interactions that pass the day. Features fine performances and much hilarious to-camera addresses, whereby characters vent their deepest frustrations. “The Office” skilfully captures the monotony of office work and the relieving of ennui with innumerable trivialities. Ep 1 - Introduces the main characters including arch petty rivals Tim and Gareth; establishes the budding romance between Dawn and Tim. Ep 2: When a pornographic picture of Brent is circulated, Gareth investigates. Ep 3: Tim’s birthday; quiz night at the pub. Ep 4: Staff training day. Ep 5: Tim considers resignation; Gareth takes an unhealthy interest in the new girl. Ep 6: Cutbacks cause staff disgruntlement.

results.title: The Office Picnic
results.brief_description: Clyde is a typical junior clerk in a public service office. He watches the budding friendship between two co-workers and he turns it into the permanent office joke. At the same time he plays out his own neurotic relationship with a bored and frustrated secretary. The cruel mass victimisation of the young lovers is carried to the annual office picnic. Office tensions are changed by the unfamiliar surroundings where the disappearance of the two lovers forces Clyde to re-examine his own shallow emotional development.

results.brief_description: Odysseus tells of his visit to King Aeolus, keeper of the winds, and of the destruction of his fleet by the Laestrygonian giants

results.title: The Odyssey
results.creator_credit: Roz Phillips and Burbank Films Australia
results.brief_description: This adaptation of Homer’s classic tale “The Odyssey” is designed for children. Odysseus’s classic adventures include his encounter with the Cyclops and his experiences in the land of the Lotus Eaters where his crew succumb to a strange lethargy. After ten years of wandering the seas in order to return to his island home of Ithica, Odysseus finds that all is not well in his kingdom on his return.

results.title: The Odds against
results.creator_credit: Helen Kirstt Radin and Lee R. Bobker
results.brief_description: Explores the correctional system in the United States, including detention, probation, imprisonment and parole. Shows a contrast between older institutions and modern facilities and methods throughout the country. Narrated by Herschel Bernardi.

results.title: The Occupant
results.creator_credit: Ettore Siracusa, Michael Karris, Peter Lyssiotis and Masterthief Enterprises
results.brief_description: An experimental look at the migrant experience through the alienation of a Greek photographer. The photographer, Peter Lyssiotis, with memories of his homeland Cyprus, his relationship with his father and fantasies based in the photographer’s everyday life is well known for his work in photography, photomontage and photo books. He recently collaborated with Ettore Siracusa and Michael Karaglanidis on this film which explores some of the themes and practices of his photographic work.

results.title: The Objectives of criminal punishment
results.creator_credit: Geoff Russell, Peter Wiseman and Video Classroom
results.brief_description: What is the objective of criminal sanctions imposed on individuals found guilty of breaking the community’s laws? Reveals the many dilemmas faced by our legal systemin balancing society’s expectation for protection (and the punishment and rehabilitation of offenders) against the rights of the criminal in order to ultimately reach a ‘just’ outcome. Explores and evaluates the goals of the criminal justice system: Community Protection, Reform, Rehabilitation, Deterrence, Retribution. Includes teacher’s notes.

results.title: The Oberon submarine
results.creator_credit: Vincent Donovan and Australia. Navy Office. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Illustrates the Royal Australian Navy’s latest class of submarine. Four of these Oberon submarines are now in use and two others are to be built.

results.title: The Obedient flame
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren, John Grierson and Science Film
results.brief_description: Charming promotional film extolling the virtues of gas cooking through a series of simple animations. Gender stereotypes are anachronistic, but innocent rather than patronising - intended audience was contemperaneous “housewives”. McLaren’s animations employ an economical graphic style strongly influenced by the art deco and industrial aesthetics of the day - as always, stiking and appealing. The last film Norman McLaren made in the United Kingdom.
